meanings.definition: A person or group that has the power to influence the choice of a leader or ruler.
meanings.sent1: The kingmakers in the kingdom were the council members who advised the queen on important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The political party became the kingmakers when they endorsed the candidate for president.
meanings.sent3: The kingmakers at the school were the students who always knew which games to play during recess.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, designers are the kingmakers who decide which trends become popular.
meanings.sent5: The kingmakers in the music industry are the producers who can make or break an artist's career.

meanings.definition: Those who have the ability to determine the outcome of a political situation by their actions or decisions.
meanings.sent1: During the negotiation, the kingmakers were the diplomats who held the key to reaching a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent2: In the boardroom, the CEO and CFO were the kingmakers who could make or break a business deal.
meanings.sent3: The kingmakers at the party were the friends who always knew how to liven up the atmosphere with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawns may seem insignificant, but they can be the kingmakers in deciding the winner.
meanings.sent5: The kingmakers in the movie industry are the directors who have the vision to turn a script into a blockbuster.
